availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Julius Augustus Jackson (Webster County, Kentucky, Farmer.)

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. Hopkins County, Kentucky, native. Son of Charles King Jackson and Jane Dumville Jackson. Married to Nancy R. Cox Jackson in Hopkins County, Kentucky, on March 29, 1854. Father of Charles Jackson, David F. Jackson, Boyd Jackson, and John Jackson. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860. Employed Ferdinand Jackson as a farmer in Webster County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 133B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 470.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 430A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, District 3, p. 209A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hopkins County Marriages, Film #007719745.
"Julius Augustus Jackson (1829-1906)," Find A Grave, Memorial #98476322, accessed April 25, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/98476322.
